analyzed: tshor ba la sogs zhes pa phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates are said to be feeling, etc.

original: dbang bo rnams nyid de zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams nyid do //
analyzed: dbang bo rnams nyid de zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams nyid do //
translated: The very sense faculties are said to be the sense bases of eye, etc.

original: zhe sdang la sogs so zhes pa nyon mongs pa ste de rnams nyid 'khor pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs so zhes pa nyon mongs pa ste de rnams nyid 'khor pa'o //
translated: Hatred, etc. are the afflictions. They are samsara.

original: 'di rnams chos ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'di rnams chos ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: These dharmas are nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzus la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste gzugs la sogs pa dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzus la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste gzugs la sogs pa dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the dharmas of eye, etc. are nirvana, which is the inseparability of form, etc.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are neither conventional truth nor ultimate truth.

original: 'dis ni 'khor ba nyid bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyis kyi bdag nying can te mya ngan las 'das pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'khor ba nyid bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyis kyi bdag nying can te mya ngan las 'das pa yang ngo //
translated: By this, samsara itself has the nature of the two truths, and so does nirvana.

original: 'di nyid chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di nyid chos rnams so //
translated: This is the dharmas.

original: rmongs phyir 'khor ba'i gzugs can te //
analyzed: rmongs phyir 'khor ba'i gzugs can te //
translated: Because of delusion, it has the form of samsara.

original: rmongs phyir zhes pa rang rig pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'khor ba'i gzugs can te skye ba dpa' dgag pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rmongs phyir zhes pa rang rig pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'khor ba'i gzugs can te skye ba dpa' dgag pa'i chos can no //
translated: Because of delusion, i.e., because of the non-realization of self-awareness, there is the form of cyclic life, i.e., the subject that is the negation of birth, by the very adherence to the grasped and the grasper.

original: @250b rmongs med 'khor ba dag pa yi //
analyzed: @250b rmongs med 'khor ba dag pa yi //
translated: Without delusion, there is the purification of cyclic life.

original: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //

original: 'khor ba de nyid dag pas slar rmongs pa med pa rang rig pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba de nyid dag pas slar rmongs pa med pa rang rig pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rmongs med 'khor ba dag pa yis //
analyzed: rmongs med 'khor ba dag pa yis //

original: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems ni sgrib med de byang chub sems ni sgrib pa'o //

analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /

analyzed: rang gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir ;
translated: For the sake of accomplishing one's own and others' goals.

original: / su khu ba dang aa bdag med ma bde ba zhes pa sva'o //

translated: â€œWide-eyedâ€ is the nature of the truth body.

translated: â€œAdorned with form and youthâ€

analyzed: brtan pa zhes pa g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnyis su med pa'o //

analyzed: rang yang bdag nyid kyang ngo //

analyzed: sngo bsangs zhes pa gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sihla ga pur yang dag 'byung //

analyzed: zhes pa / dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa nyid kyis spro ba dang sdud pa'i rang bzhin no //

analyzed: de ni aa ham ngar 'dzin pa'o //

original: yang na / aa yig dang ham yig gi rang bzhin zhes pa ste /

original: skye gnas 'khor lo'i aa yig dang // bde ba chen po ham yig go //ğŸ”½gang zhig skye gnas 'khor lo'i aa yig ma ning de ni bde chen 'khor lo'i ham yig go //

analyzed: gang zhig bde chen 'khor lo'i ham yig de ni skye gnas 'khor lo'i aa yig go //

original: 'dis ni gnyis ka sbyar ba las sngags bzlas aa ham zhes pa sgra'i rab bzhin to /
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis ka sbyar ba las sngags bzlas aa ham zhes pa sgra'i rab bzhin to /

analyzed: sgra'i cha dang bral ba'i cha'o //

original: skyes pa dge slong sngags 'don pa /
analyzed: skyes pa dge slong sngags 'don pa /

analyzed: gcer bu skra dang kha spu bregs //

analyzed: zhes pa don go sla ba nyid do //

analyzed: dge slong ni sangs rgyas te sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //

analyzed: gcer bu zhes pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das de yang sgrib pa med pa'i mtha' chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //

original: don rab tu gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don rab tu gsal ba nyid do //

original: 'di rnams rkyen gyis sems can rnams //

original: sangs rgyas nyid du the tshom med //

analyzed: zla ba bcu yang sa rnams te //

translated: Having seen all those goddesses with vajras, in order to arouse them again, he praises them with the sound of true praise. The one with a vajra is Vajradhara, indivisible wisdom.

analyzed: yang dag par bstod pa'i sgras bskul bar mdzad de ;

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rmi lam lta bu thos nas de rnams thams cad srog rnyed par gyur to //

analyzed: de yi skyon ni gcod par byed //

analyzed: de bzhin zhi ba'i thabs shes pa //
